intro: Commelina striata, commonly known as the streaked spiderwort, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions of the Americas. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring slender stems and lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, blue or violet flowers with three petals, often clustered in a raceme at the tip of the stem. Its roots are fibrous and adapted for anchoring in moist, well-drained soils. Commelina striata is often found in wetlands, marshes, and along stream banks, where it thrives in humid conditions.
